docs.title: CrowdVision User Guide
docs.text:
Welcome to the CrowdVision User Guide. CrowdVision is a comprehensive digital twin and crowd analytics platform designed to help facility managers, administrators, and users monitor building occupancy, environmental conditions, and safety alerts in real-time.

This guide covers how to navigate the dashboard, interact with the 3D digital twin, manage building data, and handle notifications.

docs.title: 🚀 Getting Started
docs.text: To access the platform, navigate to the landing page. From there, you can launch the main application.

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
While some features may be visible as a guest, administrative actions (like editing room details) require an account.

  1. Sign Up:

    • Click the Login button in the navigation bar.
    • Select "Don't have an account? Sign up".
    • Enter a Username, valid Email, and Password.
    • Click Create Account.

  2. Login:

    • Enter your credentials in the Login modal.
    • Once authenticated, your username will appear in the top navigation bar.

docs.title: 🔔 Notifications & Alerts
docs.text: CrowdVision sends alerts instantly if something happens.

docs.title: The Notification Bell
docs.text: Located in the top-right of the navigation bar: * Red Badge: Indicates the number of unread notifications. * Status Dot: * 🟢 Green: Connected to the live notification server. * 🔴 Red: Offline/Disconnected.

docs.title: Alert Types
docs.text:
• ● Alerts (Red): Critical warnings (e.g., "Overcrowded", "High Temperature").
  • ● Info (Blue): General system updates or standard notifications.

Click the bell icon to view the history of recent notifications. The counter resets once you open the dropdown.

docs.title: 🧠 AI Assistant & Insights
docs.text: Welcome to the future of facility management. The new AI Assistant integrates directly with your dashboard to provide intelligent insights, answer queries, and help you manage your crowd data using natural language.

docs.title: 🎥 See it in Action
docs.text: Watch how the AI analyzes room occupancy in real-time.

docs.title: 1. Natural Language Queries
docs.text: Stop digging through complex tables. Just ask. The AI understands context about your building's structure and can answer questions like: * "Which rooms are currently overcrowded?" * "What is the average temperature in the Science Block?" * "Is Room 101 safe for a class of 30 right now?"

docs.title: 2. Intelligent Reasoning
docs.text: Powered by advanced models, the system doesn't just read data—it reasons about it. It can suggest actions, such as recommending alternative rooms when one is full.

docs.title: 3. Automated Reporting
docs.text: The AI runs in the background to detect anomalies that simple thresholds might miss, keeping your facility safe and efficient.

docs.title: 🖼️ Interface Gallery
docs.text: Chat Interface AI Insights Panel Interact naturally with the system View auto-generated suggestions

docs.title: 🚀 Getting Started with AI
docs.text:
1. Log in to your dashboard.
  2. Click the Sparkle Icon (✨) in the navigation bar.
  3. Type your query or select a preset prompt.

ℹ️ Note: AI features require an active internet connection to communicate with our LLM providers.

docs.title: 📊 The Dashboard
docs.text: The Dashboard is your command center for real-time analytics. It provides a tabular view of all rooms within a selected building.

docs.title: Interface Overview
docs.text:
• Time & Date: Displayed prominently at the top for quick reference.
  • Model Selection: Use the dropdown menu to switch between different buildings (e.g., "Main Campus", "Science Block").

docs.title: Room Statistics Table
docs.text:
The data table provides live metrics for every room. Here is what each column represents:

Column Description Room The unique identifier or number of the room. Status A calculated text indicator of occupancy (see logic below). Teacher The name of the staff member currently scheduled (if applicable). Temp Current room temperature. People Real-time count of occupants detected by sensors. Capacity The maximum allowed number of people for the room.

docs.title: Occupancy Status Logic
docs.text:
CrowdVision automatically calculates the status of a room based on the percentage of capacity filled:

Status Color Indicator Condition Empty Emerald 0% Occupancy Normal Blue 1% – 50% Occupancy Crowded Orange 51% – 95% Occupancy Full Red 96% – 100% Occupancy Overcrowded Red > 100% Occupancy

Focus Mode

Click the Focus Mode button (top-left of the dashboard) to enter fullscreen. This is ideal for display screens in lobbies or control rooms. The text scales up automatically for better readability from a distance.

docs.title: Domain Management
docs.text: New in v2.0.0 CrowdVision now supports Multi-Domain Management, allowing you to switch between different organizations with a single account.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: A Domain represents a distinct organization or environment. Users can: 1. Create new domains (if authorized). 2. Subscribe to public domains to access their buildings and sensors. 3. Switch between domains to view specific digital twins.

docs.title: 🖥️ Managing Domains
docs.text: Navigate to the Domain Management page via the dashboard. Here you can search for organizations and manage your memberships.

docs.title: Creating a New Domain
docs.text:
Click the + Add button to open the creation wizard.

  1. Main Domain: Enter the unique identifier (e.g., university.edu).
  2. Authentication Strategy:
    • Standard: Users join freely or by invitation. Managed entirely by CrowdVision.
    • External SSO (OIDC): Connects to an external Identity Provider (like Keycloak, Auth0, or Google). Users must authenticate via that provider to join.
  3. Subdomains: (Optional) Add related sub-organizations (e.g., engineering.university.edu).

docs.title: Subscribing & Unsubscribing
docs.text:
The list displays all available domains.

  • Subscribe: Click to join.
    • For Standard Domains: You join immediately as a "Viewer".
    • For SSO Domains: You will be redirected to the external login page to verify your identity.
  • Unsubscribe: Click "Leave" to remove the domain from your profile.

docs.title: 🔐 Private Domains
docs.text: (Coming Soon) Private domains allow for invite-only access. Currently, the "Private" button is a placeholder for future functionality.

docs.title: 🏢 3D Digital Twin View
docs.text: The Model View offers an interactive 3D representation of your building. This allows you to visually locate rooms, check their layout, and manage their properties.

docs.title: Navigating the 3D Scene
docs.text:
• Rotate: Click and drag your mouse to rotate the building.
  • Zoom: Scroll up/down or use the control panel buttons.
  • Select Room: Click on any room block to select it. The selected room will turn Green (#10b981) and become semi-transparent.

docs.title: The Control Panel
docs.text:
Located at the bottom center of the screen, the control panel provides quick actions:

  • Reset View: Returns the camera to the default starting position.
  • Focus on Room (Explode): Isolates the selected room by expanding the view, allowing you to see it clearly apart from the rest of the building structure.
  • Zoom In: Moves the camera closer.
  • Zoom Out: Moves the camera further away.
  • Panorama Mode: Toggles an automatic rotation of the building for showcase purposes.

docs.title: Managing Buildings & Floors (Left Menu)
docs.text: The sidebar on the left allows you to: 1. Select Building: Choose which building structure to visualize. 2. Filter by Floor: Click on a specific floor number to hide other floors and focus only on that level. 3. Upload Model: You can upload a JSON file containing a new building configuration.

docs.title: Room Details & Editing (Right Menu)
docs.text:
When a room is selected, a panel on the right appears with specific details.

Editing a Room: If you have the necessary permissions, you can edit room parameters: 1. Select a room in the 3D view. 2. Click the Edit button in the right panel. 3. Modify the following fields: * Room ID: The unique name/number. * Capacity: Max number of people. * Max Temperature: The threshold for temperature alerts (default is 28°C). * Theme Color: The color used to represent the room in charts or headers. 4. Click Save.
